body.name: Thunder on the Chisholm Trail: A Historical Western Adventure Novel

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #9,266 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #16 in Louis L'Amour Westerns #54 in Western Fiction Classics #113 in Westerns (Books)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Another exceptionally innovative story by an outstanding Author!
reviews.reviewText: Five stars, and more, for this captivating western folklore masterpiece, as you will find, as I did, you cannot put the book aside until the epilogue has been read!Some of the most outstanding, and definitely entertaining, storylines I have had the opportunity to read! And I have read a few! No slowdowns throughout the entire series of entertaining adventures that will pacify anyone's desired expectations from beginning to end! Too, the exceptionally selected characters are unsurpassed in their respective assignments throughout the entire series of unending excitement!Without hesitation, I recommend this compelling series of one exciting adventure after the other to all readers, regardless of your normal reading pleasures! I was unable to put this on aside until the last paragraph was absorbed! This included the epilogue, as well!!!😃

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great to me
reviews.reviewText: Close to a five but not quite still all in all I enjoyed it and yes I do recommend it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Pretty good read. Likeable characters, but hard to believe they all got together. The location of the story went from rolling plains like Kansas to mountains like the base of the Colorado's about 2 days away by horse.About two full days in daylight or about 60 miles. They did it at night. Well.....An Indian sidekick, not named Tonto, who speaks with no accent or syntax difficulties left me waiting for the announcement he was a Harvard grad - but it never came.I can't really give this a strong recommend, but I can't say not to read, either.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great story absolutely redemption
reviews.reviewText: He’s an outlaw that wants to stop and begging again. He find redemption when he sees a struggling family trying to survive. He then meets a young woman and this starts his new life as he wants it! I voluntarily reviewed an Advanced Reader Copy of this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars bad to good
reviews.reviewText: This is a story about an outlaw so upset with an another outlaw gang that he decides to become good. Strange but in this case with the right woman beside him it works. Definitely had to fight to get his chances but in the end it was worth it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Essence of Revenge and Redemption
reviews.reviewText: Thunder on the Chisholm Trail: A Historical Western Novel is, in fact, the essence of revenge and redemption! Henry McConley delivers yet another outstanding western novel with well-developed and believable characters. Jack and Eliza ride through this adventure seeking justice for their community and for themselves. Yes! They are flawed people with whom we immediately identify, and with whom we become friends as we follow them through their story. By the close of the novel, we hate to let them go. We want more! What do we do? Why, of course, we find the next exciting McConley western to enjoy!Anthony Lyons of Dodge City

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: From the very start was caught up right to the very end. One of the best author i have read

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars another good story
reviews.reviewText: To me this was a bit different from his usual stories but it was just as good. A bit long but moved quickly. Good for any age to enjoy

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 24, 2023

reviews.reviewTitle: It was a slow moving book for me.
reviews.reviewText: No typos or grammatical errors in this book. That is a real plus for me. There will be many people who will like it. It just took me a long time to get through the book for me. Keep up the good work.
